snippet: Gov. Peter Shumlin on Monday signed a law that will raise the state’s minimum wage, now $8.73 an hour, to $10.50 by 2018.
abstract: Vermont Gov Peter Shumlin signs law that will raise the state's minimum wage, now $8.73 an hour, to $10.50 by 2018.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Peter Shumlin on Monday signed a law that will raise the state’s minimum wage, now $8.73 an hour, to $10.50 by 2018.

headline.main: Vermont: Minimum Wage to Climb to $10.50 by 2018
headline.print_headline: Vermont: Minimum Wage to Climb to $10.50 by 2018
